alert.note: Alert for Floyd; Martin; Pike (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 15 at 2:03PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Martin, northeastern Floyd and northwestern Pike Counties through 245 PM EDT... At 203 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Corn Fork Hollow, or over Prestonsburg, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Endicott around 210 PM EDT. McCombs around 220 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Pleasant, Moree, Davella, Delong, Heenan, Jarad, Prince, Debord and Pevier. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Kentucky Highway 3 in Martin County between mile markers 1 and 8. Kentucky Highway 80 in Floyd County near mile marker 14. U.S. Highway 23 in Floyd County between mile markers 11 and 13. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
